Legal_Issue: Standard of review for 'membership in a particular social group' under section 96 of IRPA
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Section 96
Application_Facts: Mr. B323, a Tamil from Sri Lanka, was deemed a refugee sur place due to his association with Tamil passengers on the M.V. 'Sun Sea'. He lacked credible persecution claims when leaving Sri Lanka.
Decision_Outcome: The application for judicial review was granted; the matter was referred back for redetermination.
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the refugee status determination
Court_Ruling: The court certified a question regarding the standard of review and referred the case for redetermination.

Legal_Standard: Correctness vs. reasonableness standard of review
Assessment_Factor: Association with Tamil passengers on the M.V. 'Sun Sea' as forming a particular social group
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review by the Federal Court followed by certification of a question of general importance
Review_Standard: Certified question: Whether the determination of 'membership in a particular social group' is subject to correctness or reasonableness standard
Credibility_Assessment: Mr. B323's claims were not considered credible at the time of departure from Sri Lanka
Evidence_Used: Association with Tamil passengers on the M.V. 'Sun Sea', country conditions in Sri Lanka
